intro: Rhamnidium orbiculatum, commonly known as the orbiculate rhamnoid, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rhamnaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its small, orbicular leaves and clusters of yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its bark is smooth and often has a reddish or brownish hue, while its fruits are small, spherical drupes. Rhamnidium orbiculatum is adapted to dry and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
